Company Description  CREATIVITY IS OUR SUPERPOWER. It’s our heritage and it’s also our future. Because we don’t just make toys. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. Mattel is at its best when every member of our team feels respected, included, and heard—when everyone can show up as themselves and do their best work every day. We value and share an infinite range of ideas and voices that evolve and broaden our perspectives with a reach that extends into all our brands, partners, and suppliers. The Team: Our team supports best-in-class product design by applying high quality standards in CAD modeling and applying advanced engineering simulation techniques. We leverage our experience in design for assembly and manufacturing to promote the most effective designs while paying attention to cost and structural concerns. Team members utilize global resources to accomplish their tasks and extend our effective reach. No challenge goes unaccepted. Job Description  The Opportunity: The Associate Computer Application Engineer (CAE) will work within the Mechanical Design and CAE department located in East Aurora and report directly to the Manager, Mechanical Design & Computer Applications Engineering. Primary tasks include working with Product Development Engineers to setup 3D simulations of products based on internal standards, regulatory requirements, or general concerns. The Associate Engineer (CAE) will be responsible for predicting and diagnosing potential concerns and identifying solutions. We have a global footprint, so expect projects to come from anywhere in the world. What Your Impact Will Be: Provide accurate structural analysis of toys using computer applications Become an expert in a variety of software applications to support responsibilities including:    3D CAD development of parts and assemblies, mechanism design in a CAD environment, Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and molding analysis Apply fundamental engineering knowledge to make decisions and validate results Research new materials, apply to simulations and verify accuracy Work within team environment to deliver high quality results in a timely manner Document projects and retain information to support future initiatives Qualifications  What We’re Looking For: Must have BS Degree in Engineering Experience, interest and drive for CAD modeling and engineering simulation Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills Prior experience with engineering simulation applications is a plus Demonstrated a growth mindset by staying curious and continuously learning, embracing challenges, and improving themselves. The annual base salary range for this position is between $56,000 and $70,000. **This range is indicative of projected hiring range, however annual base salary will be determined based on a candidate’s work location, skills and experience. Additional Information  Don’t meet every single requirement? At Mattel we are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.  What It’s Like to Work Here:  We are a purpose driven company aiming to empower the next generation to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential. We live up to our purpose employing the following behaviors: We collaborate: Being a part of Mattel means being part of one team with shared values and common goals. Every person counts and working closely together always brings better results. Partnership is our process and our collective capabilities is our superpower. We innovate: At Mattel we always aim to find new and better ways to create innovative products and experiences. No matter where you work in the organization, you can always make a difference and have real impact. We welcome new ideas and value new initiatives that challenge conventional thinking. We execute: We are a performance driven company. We strive for excellence and are focused on pursuing best in class outcomes. We believe in accountability and ownership and know that our people are at their best when they are empowered to create and deliver results. Who We Are:  Mattel is a leading global toy company and owner of one of the strongest catalogs of children’s and family entertainment franchises in the world. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. We engage consumers through our portfolio of iconic brands, including Barbie, Hot Wheels, Fisher-Price, American Girl, Thomas & Friends, UNO and MEGA, as well as other popular intellectual properties that we own or license in partnership with global entertainment companies. Our offerings include film and television content, gaming, music and live events. We operate in 35 locations and our products are available in more than 150 countries in collaboration with the world’s leading retail and ecommerce companies. Since its founding in 1945, Mattel is proud to be a trusted partner in empowering children to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential. Mattel is recognized for the second year in a row as a Great Place to Work™ and as one of Fast Company’s Best Workplaces for Innovators in 2022.  Visit us at https://jobs.mattel.com/ and www.instagram.com/MattelCareers.  Mattel is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer where we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day. We welcome all job seekers including minorities, females, veterans, military spouses, individuals with disabilities, and those of all sexual orientations and gender identities.

The Steel Network is renowned for its superior product offerings and innovation in the field of light steel framing building products and much more. Our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with cutting-edge steel fabrication equipment, including roll-forming, press-breaks, lasers, welding, tooling center and more. Our core values include Honesty, Loyalty, Dedication, Life of Learning, and Compassion for Others. Learn more about our products at (www.steelnetwork.com). In addition, you will join a team responsible for the development of a variety of medical devices. Become a part of our innovative team. Apply today!  The Steel Network, Inc. does not discriminate based on race, creed, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression, age, height, weight, physical or mental ability, veteran status, military obligations, marital status, or vaccination status.

RFA Engineering (www.rfamec.com) is an engineering service provider dedicated to delivering our clients with timely engineering support and expertise. We are seeking entry-level to experienced candidates to become an integral part of our engineering team. The selected candidates will work with an experienced engineering staff using state-of-the-art engineering tools & processes. This position will operate onsite at our customer's world-class engineering and manufacturing facility located near Green Bay, WI. This is a full-time position with a full benefit package listed below that includes opportunities for professional growth, direct hire by our customers, and additional opportunities within our own organization. Design Engineer As a Design Engineer, you will be developing specialized components and systems that define the performance, durability, and reliability of cutting-edge Forestry Equipment. Job DescriptionSupport the design and development of structural, electrical and hydraulic components for forestry equipment.Conduct design reviews of new prototype components and systems.Document all design activity with CAD models, design drawings, analysis results, and design review presentation materials.Provide information and visit prototype component suppliers as necessary.Review continuous improvement cycles of production vehicles and warranty improvement based on customer and factory feedback.Work with manufacturing, product verification and validation, and suppliers to develop efficient and cost-effective designs.Use CAD Software to assist in the 3-D Modeling of components, sheet metal and possibly hydraulic & electrical routings, including light analysis of structural components.Prepare CAD models appropriate for more detailed analysis as necessary (i.e. finite element analysis (FEA).Requirements BS Degree in Engineering (Electrical, Mechanical or General)Proficiency in engineering principles including but not limited to structural mechanics, hydraulics, and electronics.Proficiency in 3D CAD - (Creo, Solid Works).Knowledge of typical engineering standards in drawing practice, dimensioning and tolerancing, drawing symbols, welding practice, etc.Prior experience with off-road equipmentPay Range: $65,000-$100,000 – Commensurate with experience About RFA Engineering RFA Engineering has provided product development and engineering services to industry leading customers since 1943. Our primary focus is the development of off highway equipment including agricultural, construction, mining, recreational, industrial, and special machines. Our work includes concept development, product design, documentation, problem-solving, simulation, optimization, and testing of components, systems and complete machines. Our engineering staff is located at our Engineering Center in Minneapolis, branch office in Dubuque, IA, and at numerous customer sites throughout the U.S.

JOB DESCRIPTION: We are looking for a creative Mechanical Engineer to work on all product stages from research and development to design and manufacture, through to installation and final commissioning. The goal is to design and fabricate mechanical components of innovation and excellence.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:· Perform a full lifecycle product development (design, develop, test prototypes, manufacture and implement)· Design systems and components that meet needs and requirements.· Produce outline designs.· Conduct experiments methodically, analyze data and interpret results.· Test and evaluate theoretical designs.· Identify, formulate, and produce effective solutions to emerging problems.· Evaluate final product’s overall performance, reliability, and safety.· Alter and modify design to meet requirements and to eliminate malfunctions.· Estimate budget and scope of project.· Solicit observations from operators.· Prepare product reports and documentation.· Engage in lifelong learning and develop new theories or methods.Pay TypeSalariedREQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, EDUCATION, AND ABILITIES:· Proven working experience in mechanical engineering.· Working experience with product lifecycle management (PLM), finite element analysis (FEA) and computational fluid dynamics (CFD)· Hands-on experience with computer-aided engineering (CAM) and computer-aided manufacturing (CAE)· Familiarity with 2D or 3D engineering design and manufacturing tools (e.g., AutoCAD, ProE or other)· Adequate knowledge of engineering analysis tools (ANSYS, ProMechanica or similar)· Mathematical computing and analysis tools knowledge (Matlab, Excel, LabView etc.)· Solid understanding of core concepts including mechanics, kinematics, thermodynamics, materials science etc.· Creativity and analytical skills· Ability to communicate technical knowledge in a clear and understandable manner.· Technical writing skills· BSc degree in EngineeringJob Type: Full-timePay: $65,000.00 - $87,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Day shiftMonday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Columbus, IN 47201: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Work Location: In person

Job Description: Mechanical/Stress Engineer Position Overview: We are seeking a skilled and motivated Mechanical/Stress Engineer to join our dynamic engineering team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring the structural integrity, reliability, and performance of our products through comprehensive analysis and optimization. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, evaluate, and enhance piping and mechanical systems, components, and structures while considering various stress factors and mechanical properties. Key Responsibilities: Perform detailed stress analysis, simulations, and calculations using advanced engineering tools and software to assess the mechanical behavior of components, systems, and structures. CAESAR ii modelling for piping systems. Evaluate pipe flexibility and stress analysis. Measure the effects of support settlement, safety relief valves, seismic loads, thermal cycle loads and wind. Select proper springs for necessary support. Analysis capabilities for Jacketed Piping system, FRP Piping system, Expansion joints piping system etc. Analysis capabilities the considering the effects of the modular design and transit phase, static & differential structural deflections associated with fabrication, lift, transit, and site installation. Evaluate Stress, Displacement, Forces and moments on restraints for support design and Evaluate piping loads within allowable nozzle loads. Nozzle Flexibilities (WRC) and Stresses. Flange Leak Check. Dynamic analysis capabilities including modal, harmonic and response spectrum analysis. Data sheet preparation for Expansion joints, spring hanger data sheet and updating the Pipe support standards. Knowledge of piping codes and standards like ASME, API, IBR etc. Prepare technical reports, documentation, and presentations to communicate analysis findings, design recommendations, and optimization strategies to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field; Master's degree preferred. Proven 15 year experience in piping stress analysis, finite element analysis (FEA), and structural optimization. Strong understanding of material properties, mechanical testing, and their impact on stress behaviors. Familiarity with relevant industry codes, standards, and regulations governing mechanical design and stress analysis. Familiarity with piping design and layout, enough to be able to collaborate with the design team in optimizing the layout to meet project requirements. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to apply theoretical knowledge to practical engineering challenges. Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and present complex technical information to diverse audiences. Detail-oriented mindset with a dedication to producing accurate and reliable analysis results. Ability to supervise others Project management skills and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Benefits: Salary: $120-160k Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and retirement plans. Professional development opportunities to enhance technical and leadership skills. Collaborative and innovative work environment with opportunities to contribute to cutting-edge projects. Chance to work with a diverse team of engineers and experts in a growing industry. If you are a passionate Mechanical/Stress Engineer with a strong analytical mindset and a proven track record in ensuring mechanical integrity and reliability, we encourage you to apply and join our team of dedicated professionals. Your expertise will be crucial in driving the success of our projects and products while upholding the highest engineering standards.

POSITION SUMMARY: Students chosen to participate in the Co-Op program will spend several weeks engaged in one or more exciting projects with members of the New Product Development (NPD) team at White River Marine Group. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Projects may include some or all of the following tasks: Works closely with Industrial Designers through the various stages of New Product Development. Provides engineering expertise in the selection of raw materials and manufacturing processes, as well as structural designs and compliance with regulatory and safety standards. Works closely with Computer Aided Design Technicians in the preparation of fully detailed 3D CAD models for structural and hydrodynamic analysis. Develops and maintains databases of material properties via technical data sheets or through experimental testing. Performs stress analysis via FEA software on various marine structures including but not limited to: seats, fasteners, trailers, superstructures, platforms, ski pylons, hulls/decks/stringers made of fiberglass composite, aluminum or plastic. Determines appropriate safety margins based on sound engineering practices and appropriate regulatory standards. Works closely with sourcing staff and vendors in the screening, evaluation, and comparative testing of current and future raw materials. Employs design of experiments and various ASTM, ISO, or ABYC standardized mechanical testing to determine suitability of materials for specific applications. Works closely with fiberglass tooling shop technicians to gain an understanding of the open and closed molding techniques. Works hands-on to build multiple molded parts or production tooling molds. May perform some aspects of Computer Aided Design such as 3D modeling, technical drawings, component packaging, etc. ALL OTHER DUTIES AS ASSIGNED EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum Degree Required: Working towards a four-year degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or Marine Engineering from an ABET accredited institution Preferred Degree: Bachelor of Science Degree in Mechanical Engineering Certificate(s) or License(s): CATIA or SOLIDWORKS certifications are a plus Experience: Junior or Senior level engineering student Overall GPA: 3.0/4.0 or higher KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITY: Ability to translate designs into physical mock-ups and solid or surface models using computer aided design software. Familiar with common power tools and equipment used for fabrication in wood, metal, plastic, or fiberglass. Excellent teamwork skills. Independent thinker and problem solver. Catia experience preferred. Experience with finite element analysis or other physics-based simulation software preferred. TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS: This position is located within a comfortable office environment at White River Marine Group Headquarters in Springfield, MO. Projects may be co-located in a manufacturing plant and may involve frequent liaison trips to plants or local lakes. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Regular computer work and sitting Occasional walking, standing, and lifting up to 50lbs WORK ENVIRONMENT: Office Manufacturing/Plant INDEPENDENT JUDGEMENT: Performs tasks and duties under general supervision, using established procedures and innovation. Chooses from limited alternatives to resolve problems. Occasional independent judgment is required to complete work assignments. Often makes recommendations to work procedures, policies, and practices. Full Time Benefits Summary: Enjoy discounts on retail merchandise, our restaurants, world-class resorts and conservation attractions! Medical Dental Vision Health Savings Account Flexible Spending Account Voluntary benefits 401k Retirement Savings Paid holidays Paid vacation Paid sick time Bass Pro Cares Fund And more! Product Engineer I - CAE The Product Engineer – Analytical Verification, as a key member of the advanced engineering product design team, will be responsible for the supporting functional verification of advanced concept designs through simulation analysis. The Product Engineer –Analytical Verification will work closely with the product design team in the early stages of the concept design to optimize for performance and durability prior to prototype testing and development. Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Masters preferred. 1+ year of engineering experience MS Office proficient Experience with modeling mechatronic systems. Experience with CAD software such as CATIA or PRO E. Experience with CAE tools such as Adams, Motion Solve, Matlab/Simulink/Simscape & FEA. CarSim & GT Suite experience desirable. Key Accountabilities: Perform standard engineering analysis to support advanced product design group. Interface with Core/Component Eng. Groups to support advanced product design group. Assist the design, development and validation of driveline products with adherence to engineering disciplines and provide results in a timely manner. Support creation of Analytical Design Validation Plan. Perform multi-body dynamic simulation modelling for functional verification and performance optimization on advanced driveline design concepts and mechatronic systems. Utilize other simulation tools for modelling of complex systems to aid in the concept design process. Develop product specific modelling techniques and tools to assist in design parameter selection. Use validation testing data to correlate simulation models for improvements in the simulation modelling process. Support customer technical meetings and presentations. Support problem solving activities through simulations as required. Support DFMEA activity as required. Support Linamar launch process (CFLP) for program execution. Utilize problem solving techniques such as 8-D, IS/IS-NOT, fishbone, Red X and 6-Panels as part of failure analysis. This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of this position and it is not intended to be an exhaustive list of skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Desired Characteristics: Strong decision making skills, with the ability to grasp technical concepts quickly Knowledge of manufacturing processes is desirable Excellent oral and written communication skills A high level of oral and written communication skills Experience written technical specifications and test reports  Why McLaren Engineering Comprehensive benefits package including an employee assistance program and health savings account 401(k) with competitive company match Continuous learning and development programs Paid holidays Site and companywide community outreach Quarterly health and wellness events  About Linamar and McLaren Engineering Powering Vehicles, Motion, Work, and Lives since 1966. Linamar Corporation is a Canadian diversified global manufacturing company of highly engineered products across global industries and markets. From the entrepreneurial seeds planted by our dynamic founder, to the support provided along the way, all Linamar employees are poised for success in this fast-paced and rapidly growing environment. With access to the tools you need to succeed, you will make an impact along with other motivated and engaged employees. McLaren Engineering, the engineered products division of Linamar Corporation, is a company focused on the design, development and testing of advanced automotive driveline & powertrain systems. Linamar Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and encourages diversity in the workplace without regard to any basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. Linamar Corporation encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will reasonably accommodate applicants throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process upon request. APPLY TODAY SEE JOB DESCRIPTION BELOW Job Title: Mechanical Engineer Reports to: Engineering Manager Department: Engineering Job Classification: Exempt Direct Reports: N/A Salary Grade/Range: N/A Position Summary: To serve as mechanical design engineer for the mechanical engineering department including interpretation of specifications, design engineering, selection of major components, creation and checking of drawings, preparation and checking of calculations, and interfacing with Shop and Service personnel during manufacturing and installation. Education, Skills, and Experience: Education Bachelor of Science – Mechanical Engineer preferred Professional Engineer a plus Skills Ability to work with little or no supervision using established guidelines, procedures and in accordance with company policies Excellent verbal and written communication skills Proficient with problem solving and conflict resolution Proficient with Microsoft Office products Experience Machine design experience preferred Static and dynamic design analysis experience preferred Fatigue stress analysis experience preferred Experience with ANSYS FEA software preferred Previous material handling industry experience preferred Personal Behaviors: Commit to the mission, vision, and values of American Crane Conduct self in a manner that represents ACECO and GRIT Matters Participate in required training to maintain skill level Communicate effectively with all customers (internal/external), including understanding, speaking, reading, and writing in English Work Hard, Have Fun, and Do the Right Thing Essential Job Functions: 30% Perform basic design calculations by hand or by using standard engineering computer programs such as MathCad or ANSYS, both structural and mechanical, to permit selection of components and preparation of drawings. 20% Transfer project knowledge and background to mechanical designer(s) for completion of detail drawings and bills of material. Provide support throughout design phase of project as needed. 10% Review new orders received from the sales department, review specifications if applicable and compare information to sales proposal, check for omissions or errors in the order as received from sales, and resolve any discrepancies with the salesman. 10% Select purchased components from manufacturer’s catalogs and prepare purchase requisitions. 10% Prepare arrangement and layout drawings of equipment as required. Prepare and/or check drawings to be sent for customer approval. 10% Check detail drawings prepared by draftsman for completion and correctness; prepare detail drawings if draftsman is not available. 5% Interface with customers as directed by the Project Manager to obtain approval of drawings and design. Answer any questions the customer may have concerning the design. Visit customer’s facility, if necessary, to review project and verify dimensions. This requires the ability to climb onto the equipment in question. 5% Work with shop personnel to answer questions and resolve problems encountered during manufacture of the equipment. Physical Demands: Ability to work a minimum of full-time hours; overtime required based on Engineering schedules Hand/eye coordination is necessary to operate tools and equipment Occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to touch, handle and/or operate objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms Occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk and hear; smell Ability to lift and/or move objects up to 50 pounds Specific vision abilities required include close vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus Work Location and Environment Ability to work on-site in an office environment Ability to work in outside weather conditions Ability to work near moving mechanical parts and in precarious places Occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, fumes or airborne particles and vibration Other Special Working Conditions: Employees that become disabled as defined under the Americans with Disabilities Act must be able to perform the essential job functions (as listed) either unaided or with the assistance of a reasonable accommodation to be determined by management on a case-by-case basis. column7: Gloyer-Taylor Laboratories (GTL) is a growing Aerospace Engineering company developing high performance liquid hydrogen storage systems which will enable a new class of aircraft and rocket systems. GTL is looking to fill a Composites Engineering position which will support the design and fabrication of the company’s composite propellant tanks, rocket components and structures at its Tullahoma, TN office. Work includes exposure to export restricted materials and requires security clearance eligibility. Work eligibility will be confirmed through E-Verify. All job offers will be contingent upon successful completion of a criminal background check. Job Duties:Conduct applied research on many different tasks/subtasks of government contracts and internal research and development projects Perform engineering tasks to support the development of composite components and structures for use in aerospace systems, launch vehicles and other space systems. Tasks include, but are not limited to:    Formulate, design, and analyze conceptual designs of aerospace products and systemsDesign, analyze, and fabricate tooling, test articles, fixtures, and molds for composite structures and pressure vesselsDevelop design criteria for aerospace products and systemsEvaluate designs for conformance to engineering principles, customer requirements, and GTL quality standardsAssist with load, burst, cycle and qualification testing of composite structures and aerospace systems componentsAssist in writing technical reports or other documentation for use by engineering staff, management, and/or customersProvide technical guidance to engineers, technicians, design and management teamSupport business development efforts such as writing proposals, meeting customers, and identifying business opportunitiesSupport GTL management as needed. Desired Skills/Experience: Since GTL offers such a diverse line of products and services, candidates are expected to be flexible and comfortable working on multiple assignments with varying subject matter. This includes creating a prototype all the way from the concept and design stage to actually performing hands-on work and physically building the hardware and systems. Candidates should be comfortable working with both hand tools and power tools. The ideal candidate would have a broad background with the following additional experience preferred:Experience designing, fabricating, and manufacturing composite structures and toolingExperience in layup, shape forming, and machining for structural composite prototypes and products Experience in composite component structural analysis and FEAExperience in CAD, CAM, and design/drawing review processesITAR Requirements: To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about ITAR here. GTL Company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or genetics.

FEA Engineer: Senior Mechanical Engineer - Closures, Body, and Joint Technology
column7: About Us  Moxion is a vertically integrated manufacturer of all-electric mobile power and energy storage solutions. We have developed commercial-scale, powerful, silent, and emissions-free mobile battery stations that are designed to replace traditional diesel generators in most applications today. We’re pioneering mobile energy storage technology, leveraging vertical integration and a software-enabled service model to deliver last-mile electrification for our customers and communities. The Moxion team is a passionate group of humans who care about the environment and disrupting the diesel economy. Come build the first distributed utility with us, propelling the biggest energy transformation of our lifetime.  The Role  The Mechanical Engineer, Closures, Body, and Joint Technology will assume the responsibility of developing innovative and cost-effective solutions for various automotive components, including closures, sheet metal elements, and instrument panel systems. Their exceptional expertise and meticulous attention to detail will significantly contribute to the success of ongoing projects and enable the delivery of high-quality products to esteemed customers. This role will provide abundant opportunities to work on multiple products and actively engage in all stages of the product development cycle, encompassing ideation, prototyping, and high-volume manufacturing. The products designed and introduced to the market will serve as transformative forces, disrupting substantial industries that have witnessed little to no innovation in recent decades.  What you’ll do: Closures Design. Ensure functionality, structural integrity, and aesthetic appeal while adhering to industry standards and customer requirements. Sheet Metal Design: Create and optimize sheet metal components such as body panels, brackets, supports, and reinforcements. Apply design-for-manufacturability principles to improve efficiency and reduce production costs. Instrument Panel Development: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and develop instrument panels that meet ergonomic, safety, and aesthetic criteria. Ensure proper integration of electronic systems, controls, doors and other components. Prototyping and Testing: Create prototypes and conduct rigorous testing to validate design concepts, assess performance, and identify areas for improvement. Analyze test data and implement necessary design modifications to meet quality and performance targets. Manufacturing Support: Work closely with manufacturing engineers and suppliers to ensure successful production launch and efficient manufacturing processes. Resolve design-related issues and provide technical support during the manufacturing phase. Documentation and Reporting: Prepare detailed engineering drawings, specifications, bills of materials, and technical reports. Maintain accurate records of design changes, test results, and project milestones. Collaborate with team members to ensure timely completion of project deliverables. Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including design, manufacturing, quality, and procurement. Communicate project progress, technical challenges, and potential risks to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner. Take ownership of your product: Set up design review meetings, brainstorming sessions, seek feedback from subject matter experts, take responsibility for your design and own both wins and mistakes while maintaining clear communication and positive attitude to the team. You enjoy: Creating quality products from scratch using Solidworks CAD Using mechanical design analysis (FEA) to optimize your designs Brainstorming sessions, ambiguous problem solving, and teamwork Clearly documenting your ideas and staying organized Articulating your design decisions to suppliers and other team members (even the non-technical ones) Collaborating with manufacturing to hand build the first units Fast paced environment and launching products Skills to be successful: Minimum of Bachelor's in Mechanical Engineering or related field Sheet metal design / fabrication Design for automated manufacturing processes and equipment Design verification and durability testing Design failure mode effects analysis 2D drawing creation and GD&T We currently use: Solidworks CAD Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, Slack, and Zoom Salary Information    #LI-JF1  Pay Equity  Moxion is committed to the principle of pay equity – paying employees equitably for substantially similar work. Compensation displayed is a range. Maximum amounts are reserved for those candidates that exceed all experience and background requirements. We reserve the right to offer compensation based on level of experience. Moxion has different base pay ranges for different work locations within the United States, which allows us to pay employees competitively and consistently in different geographic markets. The range above reflects the potential base pay within the San Francisco Bay area. If you live outside that region, the range is subject to change.  Base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within the range provided above. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role.  At Moxion you get  Health, dental, and vision coverage, 401K, PTO, competitive equity & compensation packages, free lunch, coffee, and snacks onsite, flexible work from home (for some roles), free tax advisory services, access to Mountain Hardware, Columbia, Sorel, & Prana employee stores and discounts, company swag, and parental leave program.  We Value  People are at the core of Moxion’s values. We care about growth for our people and team, and this translates to an open and transparent culture. Moxion believes that diversity is as core to our business as the underlying products and technology we’re developing. Diversity in people leads to diversity of thought and different perspectives to draw from, often resulting in a new or unique way of approaching or solving a problem. Diversity drives innovation.  Moxion is looking for candidates who identify with different races, religions, national origins, age groups, genders, or gender identities, and we don’t discriminate against marital status, physical or mental disability, health or medical conditions, military and veteran status, genetic information, and other classifications that may or may not be protected by law. If you can bring a unique perspective or experience to our company, please apply.    Moxion is committed to the full inclusion of all applicants. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please let our recruiting team know or email HR@moxionpower.com

Job description: Electroimpact is a custom machine and tool builder for the aircraft industry. We are seeking an experienced Civil or Mechanical Engineer with significant structural analysis experience to support ongoing and future project work. The engineer would work closely with multiple groups to support design and analysis of structures and concrete anchorages. This position is expected to prepare detailed engineering reports showing suitability of design. Ideal candidates will be able to demonstrate effective communication skills, significant technical skill, and hands-on ability.  Go to www.electroimpact.com to learn more about the company. Job Requirements: Able to communicate effectively in written and spoken English Able to lift 30 lbs to waist height frequently during the day Have an engineering degree (mechanical or civil) from an accredited program with emphasis on structural engineering, machine design, or mechanics of materials. Be a licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Washington State or another jurisdiction with ability to obtain licensure in other states as needed for project work Demonstrate familiarity with and ability to design and evaluate structures per IBC/ASCE 7/AISC 341/AISC 360/RCSC especially seismic design of non-building structures Demonstrate familiarity and ability to design and evaluate concrete and anchorages per ACI 318 Able to pass a drug test Able to work flexible hours and overtime when needed Be a US Citizen or Permanent Resident or a Canadian Citizen Will move to live within 30 minutes of Mukilteo WA. Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with RISA-3D, STAAD, Ansys or another Computational Structural Analysis or FEA Can demonstrate mechanical aptitude and understanding of mechanical systems. ABOUT FIREFLY AEROSPACEAs an end-to-end space transportation company, Firefly Aerospace is on a mission to enable our world to launch, land, and operate in space – anywhere, anytime. Our launch vehicles, lunar landers, and orbital vehicles provide government and commercial customers with full mission services from low Earth orbit to the surface of the Moon and beyond. Headquartered in north Austin, Texas, Firefly is looking for passionate, hardworking innovators to join our team and help fuel our successful trajectory into space.SUMMARYFirefly Propulsion Tooling Engineers are responsible for the design, fabrication, integration, test, and delivery of production tooling and fixturing solutions to the engine production line. Propulsion Tooling Engineers are fully integrated members of the engine team to ease communication and maximize knowledge transfer. They are makers, people who can take an idea on paper and rapidly turn it into a fully functioning component ready to support production and testing of rocket engines! RESPONSIBILITIES Collaborate closely with manufacturing engineers and other responsible engineers to identify tooling and fixturing needs to solve production and testing problemsEnd to end ownership of the design, fabrication, assembly, commissioning, and use procedures for tooling solutions Prepare and present design reviews to internal stakeholders on new and evolving tooling solutionsEffectively implement best practices of mechanical design, GD&T, analysis into tooling designsEffectively manage tooling projects through the design, fabrication, and commissioning lifecycle including budget and vendor selectionProduce, review, and release CAD and detail drawings of all tooling components and assemblies Construct and maintain a schedule for each project and report regularly on progress QUALIFICATIONS RequiredBachelor’s degree in Engineering or related technical fieldProven experience designing complex assemblies or tools Experience using CAD and FEA-based analysis softwareDeep knowledge of GD&T best practices and familiarity with ASME Y14.5Proven mechanical aptitude Able to read and interpret technical drawings and assembly instructionsExcellent written and verbal communication skills to convey methodologies for assembly and troubleshootingStrong interpersonal and conflict resolution skills – Must be a team playerProven experience with tasks requiring extreme attention to detail and prolonged mental concentrationAbility to thrive in high stakes, stressful, short deadline environmentsCritical thinking and strong decision making abilityDesiredExperience with modern manufacturing methodsExperience with complex system assembly and hands on build experience preferably in space systems or aerospace applicationsExperience with writing assembly procedures or documentation for mechanical, electrical, or structural systemsExperience writing test plans, procedures and identifying pass/fail criteria on systems. Knowledge of data analysis packages (Python/high level Excel) preferredFirefly offers outstanding benefits for our employees, including generous health, dental and vision plans with low plan deductibles, parental leave, educational reimbursement, short term disability, and flexible PTO options.  To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State.  Firefly Aerospace, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with Firefly is governed based on merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.

Who is Senior plc? Senior is a FTSE listed (symbol SNR) international manufacturing Group with 26 operations in 12 countries. Senior designs, manufactures and markets high-technology components and systems for the principal original equipment producers in the worldwide aerospace, defense, and land vehicle and power & energy markets. We have a long history of well-respected brands and an excellent reputation in our key market sectors. Senior delivers value to its customers and shareholders via operational excellence that is underpinned by its people and processes. Our global values underpin what we do, and how we do it … Safety – Integrity – Customer Focus – Respect & Trust – Accountability – Excellence Who is Senior Flexonics Pathway? This should include a brief introduction/overview of your operating business. You can include information about what you do, where you are based, your size and structure. What does the job involve? This position provides design efforts from receipt of the customer’s purchase order through production, installation and final commissioning; both in new product design and existing product redesign. What will my responsibilities include?Reviews requests for quotation and perform application engineering on the RFQ to determine what the customer desires. Determines what product best suits the customer and application. Design expansion joints per EJMA Standards (Expansion Joint Manufacturers Association) and in compliance with customer drawings, specifications, ASME VIII, B31.3, B31.1 or III and company standards.Reviews drawings, plans and other customer documents to develop and prepare sales proposals.Proposes changes in equipment, processes or use of materials and services which would result in cost reduction or improvement in operations.Provides technical services to customers regarding use, operation and maintenance of equipment.Contacts customer and representatives to promote products or services offered and resolve comments to drawings.Meets with customers and assist sales representatives to maintain relationships, deliver sales presentations, negotiate and obtain purchase orders and deliver required engineering for approval.Coordinate liaison between sales and other support functions. What key skills and experience do I need?Supports all initiatives and audits as required, including support and communication of all corporate goals.Understand and practice current ISO9000 and ISO14001 standards.May be required to travel globally.No supervisory responsibilities.Performs other duties and assignments as directed by management. What qualifications should I have?Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering preferred. Two (2) years related experience in piping design, refining or petrochemical industry and/or training or equivalent combination of education and experienceProficiency with Solidworks or similar 3d modeling software. Certification in a modeling software is a plus i.e. Certified Solidworks Associate (CSWA) or higher.Familiar with CAESAR II pipe stress analysis softwareFamiliar with ASME Section VIII, Section III, B31.1, and/or B31.3Familiar with FEA software (Solidworks Simulation or similar). Certification in an FEA software is a plus i.e. Certified Solidworks Simulation Associate (CSWA-Simulation) or higher.Current TWIC card or willing to obtain one within three months of hire.EIT certification or ability to obtain with six months of hire.Proficient with Microsoft Office software.Must be able to communicate fluently in English, both verbally and in writing, with co-workers, customers and vendors.Willing to learn and think outside the box for design solutions. Joining Senior Flexonics Pathway will provide you with a rewarding and challenging career with a competitive compensation package, a comprehensive benefits package along with wellness benefits, employee recognition program, matching 401k plan, paid vacation and tuition reimbursement. RFA Engineering (www.rfamec.com) is an engineering service provider dedicated to delivering our clients with timely engineering support and expertise. We are seeking entry-level to experienced candidates to become an integral part of our engineering team. The selected candidates will work with an experienced engineering staff using state-of-the-art engineering tools & processes. This position will operate onsite at our customer's world-class engineering and manufacturing facility located near Green Bay, WI. This is a full-time position with a full benefit package listed below that includes opportunities for professional growth, direct hire by our customers, and additional opportunities within our own organization. Design Engineer As a Design Engineer, you will be developing specialized components and systems that define the performance, durability, and reliability of cutting-edge Forestry Equipment. Job DescriptionSupport the design and development of structural, electrical and hydraulic components for forestry equipment.Conduct design reviews of new prototype components and systems.Document all design activity with CAD models, design drawings, analysis results, and design review presentation materials.Provide information and visit prototype component suppliers as necessary.Review continuous improvement cycles of production vehicles and warranty improvement based on customer and factory feedback.Work with manufacturing, product verification and validation, and suppliers to develop efficient and cost-effective designs.Use CAD Software to assist in the 3-D Modeling of components, sheet metal and possibly hydraulic & electrical routings, including light analysis of structural components.Prepare CAD models appropriate for more detailed analysis as necessary (i.e. finite element analysis (FEA).Requirements BS Degree in Engineering (Electrical, Mechanical or General)Proficiency in engineering principles including but not limited to structural mechanics, hydraulics, and electronics.Proficiency in 3D CAD - (Creo, Solid Works).Knowledge of typical engineering standards in drawing practice, dimensioning and tolerancing, drawing symbols, welding practice, etc.Prior experience with off-road equipmentPay Range: $65,000-$100,000 – Commensurate with experience About RFA Engineering RFA Engineering has provided product development and engineering services to industry leading customers since 1943. Our primary focus is the development of off highway equipment including agricultural, construction, mining, recreational, industrial, and special machines. Our work includes concept development, product design, documentation, problem-solving, simulation, optimization, and testing of components, systems and complete machines. Our engineering staff is located at our Engineering Center in Minneapolis, branch office in Dubuque, IA, and at numerous customer sites throughout the U.S.

Company Information PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality light-, medium-, and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates. PACCAR also designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines, provides financial services and information technology, and distributes truck parts related to its principal business. Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services — you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started! Peterbilt Motors Company On highways, construction sites, city streets, logging roads - everywhere our customers earn their living - Peterbilt's red oval is a familiar symbol of performance, reliability and pride. Peterbilt has reigned as America's premium quality truck manufacturer since the company's founding in 1939. Our dedication to deliver products and services focused on improving customers' performance, image, profitability and peace of mind truly makes Peterbilt the Class of the Industry.  Requisition Summary  This position will be responsible for air, electric, and fluid routings focused engineering design, development and production support. Duties involve root cause analysis, problem definition, problem resolution and reporting of work to upper management. Engineering projects may include new product development, current production design & support, field service & warranty, factory process improvements and service tool enhancements. Additional tasks include completion of six sigma documentation in assigned phases of project and applying standard engineering techniques with minimal supervision, occasionally requiring independent evaluation. This position is based at Peterbilt Division Headquarters in Denton, Texas. The Mechanical Engineer will collaborate with suppliers and other divisions within PACCAR: DAF, Kenworth, PACCAR Technical Center and the PACCAR Engine Company.  Job Functions / Responsibilities Identify and initiate routing designs of complex nature and conduct necessary research incidental to design. Complete design projects through the processes of planning, concept development, calculation and design analysis, design review, testing, evaluation, and implementation. Handle multiple tasks concurrently. Manage supplier activities related to design and manufacture of components. Apply knowledge of stress analysis and FEA. Apply knowledge of various materials and manufacturing processes to positively influence designs. Apply knowledge and skills in Creo and Windchill functionality, particularly Creo cabling. Coordinate and complete projects and design efforts with other engineering groups and departments within the company as directed. Analyze data from warranty claims to support current and future designs. Apply a proactive hands-on approach to defining issues and reaching early resolution with consensus from all stakeholders. Identify, prioritize, and coordinate resolutions of production, process control and Quality Assurance issues as appropriate. Prepare engineering activity status reports and other detailed reporting as directed. Demonstrate professional and successful communication skills (verbal/written) with strong, effective interpersonal abilities. Act in a professional manner in all contact with external and internal customers. Travel may be required. Qualifications & Skills Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering or related degree is required. Hiring level will be determined by related experience and education. Knowledge of and/or experience in heavy truck assembly, heavy truck components and systems is preferred. Previous Design experience with routings of electric harnessing or fluid hoses is heavily preferred. Previous Design experience with Creo Parametric is heavily preferred, particularly Creo Cabling software. Knowledge of vehicle routings and respective systems including engine, transmission, aftertreatment, coolant, fuel, air, battery cables and electric harnessing. Knowledge of chassis layouts and system design is preferred. Knowledge of component analysis & validation techniques is preferred. Proficiency with PowerPoint and excellent presentation skills. Proficiency with Excel. Ability to learn quickly and adapt to change. Ability to maintain progress on multiple projects and/or tasks. Demonstrated ability to negotiate effectively by advocating for strategic objectives and/or procedural requirements. Knowledge of vehicle vocations, applications, and how the customer uses the truck. PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability.  Additional Job Board Information If you would like more information about what makes PACCAR an excellent place to work, please visit the PACCAR Career Site.  PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability.

What will my responsibilities include?Reviews requests for quotation and perform application engineering on the RFQ to determine what the customer desires. Determines what product best suits the customer and application. Design expansion joints per EJMA Standards (Expansion Joint Manufacturers Association) and in compliance with customer drawings, specifications, ASME VIII, B31.3, B31.1 or III and company standards.Reviews drawings, plans and other customer documents to develop and prepare sales proposals.Proposes changes in equipment, processes or use of materials and services which would result in cost reduction or improvement in operations.Provides technical services to customers regarding use, operation and maintenance of equipment.Contacts customer and representatives to promote products or services offered and resolve comments to drawings.Meets with customers and assist sales representatives to maintain relationships, deliver sales presentations, negotiate and obtain purchase orders and deliver required engineering for approval.Coordinate liaison between sales and other support functions. What key skills and experience do I need?Supports all initiatives and audits as required, including support and communication of all corporate goals.Understand and practice current ISO9000 and ISO14001 standards.May be required to travel globally.No supervisory responsibilities.Performs other duties and assignments as directed by management. What qualifications should I have?Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering preferred. Two (2) years related experience in piping design, refining or petrochemical industry and/or training or equivalent combination of education and experienceProficiency with Solidworks or similar 3d modeling software. Certification in a modeling software is a plus i.e. Certified Solidworks Associate (CSWA) or higher.Familiar with CAESAR II pipe stress analysis softwareFamiliar with ASME Section VIII, Section III, B31.1, and/or B31.3Familiar with FEA software (Solidworks Simulation or similar). Certification in an FEA software is a plus i.e. Certified Solidworks Simulation Associate (CSWA-Simulation) or higher.Current TWIC card or willing to obtain one within three months of hire.EIT certification or ability to obtain with six months of hire.Proficient with Microsoft Office software.Must be able to communicate fluently in English, both verbally and in writing, with co-workers, customers and vendors.Willing to learn and think outside the box for design solutions. Why join Senior Flexonics Pathway? Joining Senior Flexonics Pathway will provide you with a rewarding and challenging career with a competitive compensation package, a comprehensive benefits package along with wellness benefits, employee recognition program, matching 401k plan, paid vacation and tuition reimbursement. Trade Compliance Statement Access to our facility is restricted under the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and the Export Administration Regulations (EAR) to U.S. Persons (U.S. Citizens, lawful permanent residents, U.S. Nationals, U.S. refugees, asylees, or temporary residents under amnesty provisions), and to properly licensed foreign persons. Applicants receiving a conditional offer of employment will be required to provide information to determine whether they are subject to these regulations and, if so, to assess their country of chargeability for export control purposes. Additionally, potential employee names will be screened against the Consolidated Screening List (maintained by the United States government) to determine eligibility to receive controlled technical data. Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Senior Flexonics Pathway provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state of local laws.

JOB SUMMARY This position is responsible for executing portions of the electrical designs of transformers. This includes reviewing and creating designs as well as maintaining them. S/he may evaluate products, parts, or processes for cost efficiency and reliability. This individual must possess entry-level problem-solving skills. S/he follows standard guidelines; selects from the most appropriate of several guidelines, making minor adjustments as necessary to achieve results. PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Reviews designs and processes design work. Reviews electrical design characteristics and consults with more senior engineer on design criteria or complex design issues. Participates in portions of product electrical design work Remains current with industry and technical developments and maintain a high level of expertise in designated areas of specialization. Maintains designated design, manufacturing and process related documentation. Consults with marketing, customers and design engineering staff to understand and develop innovative solutions to meet customer needs. Consults with manufacturing process leaders to develop and optimize design solutions at the optimum total cost. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES Good process and problem solving skills A team player with strong people skills; ability to build relationships Effective communication skills, including verbal (logical and organized), written, listening and presentation Computer skills: highly proficient in Microsoft applications: Power Point, Excel and Word Analytical capacity for creative problem-solving, process design and product application, design and development Data collection and analysis skills Understanding of and skill in use of specific design methods, rationales and tools (e.g. FEA, DFM, robust design) EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE Required Education / Experience Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering Preferred Education / Experience Prior experience in an engineering internship Prolec-GE Waukesha, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, or any other reason prohibited by applicable law.

Company Overview: A rocket company at the core, Relativity Space is on a mission to become the next great commercial launch company. Meeting the needs of a growing demand for space infrastructure, our rockets will revolutionize how we connect and communicate on Earth by getting satellites to space. We have developed a vertically integrated technology platform in which we leverage additive manufacturing, artificial intelligence, and autonomous robotics to 3D print rockets. Our unique approach enables rapid product iteration, allowing us to push the boundaries of what's possible today and unlock the full potential of 3D printing for tomorrow. Join us on this extraordinary journey, as we work together to transform our vision into reality. Team: The Integrated Performance department at Relativity Space is responsible for ensuring that our rockets will achieve our overall objectives and satisfy stringent customer and government requirements. Our department comprises teams responsible for Flight Sciences, including Aerodynamics, Thermal, Loads, and Dynamics; Integrated Structures Analysis; Guidance, Navigation, and Control & Vehicle Performance (GNCP); Systems Engineering; Mission Reliability; and Product Engineering. We architect and execute analysis, simulation, operations, and test projects for all of Relativity's hardware and software teams in pursuit of mission success. Overall, this department is critical to the launch success of Terran R! This is an entry-level technical role in the Flight Sciences team within the Integrated Performance department. We have multiple roles available in each of our sub-teams, such as Aerodynamics, Aerothermodynamics, Thermal, Loads & Dynamics, and Dynamic Environments. Each group is responsible for the success of our rockets and ground systems in its domain of physics. Day to day, Flight Sciences engineers work on design, analysis, test, and tools development projects across every launch system, from launch pads to engines to avionics and beyond. What you'll do:Build models of the Terran R vehicle and ground systems for detailed analysis in FEA, CFD, SEA, or thermal simulation toolsTeam up with structures and avionics designers to develop a scalable, robust architecture for component installation and environmental isolationPerform multibody dynamics analysis to simulate behavior during vehicle stage separationDevelop software tools to efficiently process thousands of individual analyses in a Monte Carlo simulationDevelop existing or new code to automate simulation, data analysis, and signal processingAnalyze Terran 1 flight data to correlate with analytical and empirical predictionsGenerate forcing functions for liftoff, aerodynamics, and engine-borne dynamic excitationPerform transient dynamic analysis in support of Coupled Loads Analysis (CLA)Support vibration and shock or thermal testing of componentsWhat you need to know:An undergraduate degree in engineering or related field and practical engineering experience, e.g., from project teams, internships, or research labsPassion for launch vehicles and spacecraftExperience solving challenging technical problems in teamsFamiliarity with Python or another scripting language like MatlabNice to haves but not required:A graduate degree (MS/PhD) in engineering or related fieldFamiliarity with launch vehicles and liquid rocket propulsion Relativity Space offers competitive salary and equity, a generous vacation policy, an annual L&D stipend and more! We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.    The below-range represents Relativity Space's current good-faith pay scale for this role. Relativity Space reserves the right to modify or update this range at any time.    Compensation is only one part of our entire total rewards package. To see some of the benefits & perks we offer, please visit here: https://px.sequoia.com/relativityspace   Hiring Range:    $90,000—$117,000 USD

For customer facing roles, develops strong customer relationships and serves as the interface between customer and GE. Explains technical information to others. Archer is an aerospace company based in San Jose, California building an all-electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft with a mission to advance the benefits of sustainable air mobility. We are designing, manufacturing, and operating an all-electric aircraft that can carry four passengers for 60 miles at speeds of up to 150 mph while producing minimal noise. Our sights are set high and our problems are hard, and we believe that diversity in the workplace is what makes us smarter, drives better insights, and will ultimately lift us all to success. We are dedicated to cultivating an equitable and inclusive environment that embraces our differences, and supports and celebrates all of our team members. We drive a pay-for-performance culture and reward performance that supports the Company's business strategy. For this position we are targeting a base pay between $81,600.00-$137,280.00. Actual compensation offered will be determined by factors such as job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Overview: McLaren Engineering Group has an immediate opening for a structural engineer in our Entertainment Division, based out of our Woodcliff Lake, NJ headquarters. RFA Engineering (www.rfamec.com) is an engineering service provider dedicated to delivering our clients with timely engineering support and expertise. We are seeking entry-level to experienced candidates to become an integral part of our engineering team. The selected candidates will work with an experienced engineering staff using state-of-the-art engineering tools & processes. This position will operate onsite at our customer's world-class engineering and manufacturing facility located near Green Bay, WI. This is a full-time position with a full benefit package listed below that includes opportunities for professional growth, direct hire by our customers, and additional opportunities within our own organization. Design Engineer As a Design Engineer, you will be developing specialized components and systems that define the performance, durability, and reliability of cutting-edge Forestry Equipment. Job DescriptionSupport the design and development of structural, electrical and hydraulic components for forestry equipment.Conduct design reviews of new prototype components and systems.Document all design activity with CAD models, design drawings, analysis results, and design review presentation materials.Provide information and visit prototype component suppliers as necessary.Review continuous improvement cycles of production vehicles and warranty improvement based on customer and factory feedback.Work with manufacturing, product verification and validation, and suppliers to develop efficient and cost-effective designs.Use CAD Software to assist in the 3-D Modeling of components, sheet metal and possibly hydraulic & electrical routings, including light analysis of structural components.Prepare CAD models appropriate for more detailed analysis as necessary (i.e. finite element analysis (FEA).Requirements BS Degree in Engineering (Electrical, Mechanical or General)Proficiency in engineering principles including but not limited to structural mechanics, hydraulics, and electronics.Proficiency in 3D CAD - (Creo, Solid Works).Knowledge of typical engineering standards in drawing practice, dimensioning and tolerancing, drawing symbols, welding practice, etc.Prior experience with off-road equipmentPay Range: $65,000-$100,000 – Commensurate with experience About RFA Engineering RFA Engineering has provided product development and engineering services to industry leading customers since 1943. Our primary focus is the development of off highway equipment including agricultural, construction, mining, recreational, industrial, and special machines. Our work includes concept development, product design, documentation, problem-solving, simulation, optimization, and testing of components, systems and complete machines. Our engineering staff is located at our Engineering Center in Minneapolis, branch office in Dubuque, IA, and at numerous customer sites throughout the U.S.

Date: Nov 6, 2023 Location: Leeds, AL, US, 35094 Company: Hubbell Incorporated    Corporate Overview     Hubbell Incorporated was founded in 1888 and has grown into an international manufacturer of quality electrical, lighting and power solutions with more than 75 brands used and recognized around the world. Our founder, Harvey Hubbell, developed tooling and equipment to serve the growing demand for new assembly and manufacturing machinery during the industrial revolution. An early, and one of many patents awarded, came for the creation of the first practical method to control electricity through the pull chain socket that remains unchanged today. As a market leader in reliable, electrical solutions, we provide more than half a million products delivered through our various business groups. Hubbell is committed to continually innovating solutions that work, transforming old products with new ideas, and ensuring that we Energize, Enlighten and Empower the communities that support us.     Division Overview     Hubbell Power Systems (HPS) engages in the design and manufacture of a wide variety of products used by utilities. Today, HPS is deeply engaged in product solutions for OSP Communication utility purposes, and has been actively growing that segment of the business. HPS roots have historically been in high voltage transmission, distribution, substation, underground products used by electric utilities. HPS products are also used in the civil construction, transportation, gas and water industries.     At HPS, we build products that provide mission critical infrastructure and that deliver communications and power to millions of people worldwide. In our business, failure is not an option. Therefore, we manufacture products of uncompromising integrity and it starts with our quality policy. We hold our partners, our suppliers and ourselves to the highest standard to ensure we exceed all the technical and functional expectations of our customers.     Hubbell Incorporated engages in the design, manufacture, and sale of electrical and electronic products in the United States and internationally. It operates in three segments: Electrical, Power, and Industrial Technology.   Position Overview       The Associate Product Engineer will be responsible for leading all aspects of all engineering functions for a given product line within the Hubbell Power Systems Electric Utility and Communications Connectors Business Unit and working with the product management team to grow the Distribution Connector sales and profitability.      Duties and ResponsibilitiesProduct line maintenance (cost reductions, drawing updates, engineering change requests, testing and communicating with various departments including operations, manufacturing engineering, sourcing, new product development & quality departments)Product line deviations (design, test & document product deviations needed for specific customer demands)Prepare 3D CAD models, draft of parts and assemblies utilizing AutoCAD inventor.Optimize designs for production using DFA & DFM principles.Perform and review FEA (structural & thermal analysis) on parts and assemblies.Review Customer specifications for requested projects, design a solution & provide costing to Product Line Manager for pricing efforts.Fabricate, assemble and test prototypes to verify performance to design criteria.Develop and review design concepts, drawings, bill of materials and assembly processes.Participate in brainstorming activities lead by NPD.Perform quality audits as needed.Perform or assist lab technicians with mechanical and/or electrical testing needs to qualify or validate product performance.Collaborate with Product Line Manager to understand industry needs and define product line extensions necessaryto gain greater market share.Assist Product Line Manager in supporting customers with application needs/questions and may include customer training of proper product application/installation.Lead up new product projects involving assigned product lines, by designing, testing and launching these products to the market.Lead up training presentations, which include hands on demonstrations and provide plan tour to customers as needed.Support quality department in solving customer complaintsSkills and ExperienceBachelors Degree in an Engineering in FEA analysisFluent in English both written and spoken; Spanish a plusProficiency in Microsoft office; SAP a plusAbility to travel up to 10% both domestic and internationally   Hubbell Incorporated,
