Sandvik Mining & Rock Solutions is looking for Sr. Design Engineer to join their Rotary Drills Division in Alachua, FL.    About Us    Sandvik is a global engineering company with over 37,000 team members worldwide. Our division headquarters in sunny Alachua, FL is where we design and manufacture world class rotary drill machines for the global surface mining industry. We offer customer focused mining solutions centered on our own employees’ passion to win while maintaining a fun and rewarding work atmosphere.    Our Culture    At Sandvik, we’re technology driven, innovative, entrepreneurial, and inclusive! Our workplace is full of dedicated and passionate team members who directly contribute to our company’s growth and success. We believe that diversity inspires, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together, and celebrating our differences. And it’s our commitments to Safety, Quality and our People in what sets us apart here in Alachua.    Key Responsibilities    The Senior Design Engineer position is responsible for assigned R&D and Engineering tasks within the Surface Mining Customer Segment at Alachua facility. Senior Design Engineer is responsible for the design tasks and technical solutions performed in the responsibility area based on the priorities set by Supervisor. Purchasing components based on requirements within MRP.  Will work in compliance with the Sandvik safety management program. Design, develop and test complex mast, frame and cab systems. Responsible that all designs are fully documented in models, drawings, and Bill of Materials. Perform a variety of calculations to substantiate design using a working knowledge of design of mechanics of materials, design/application of machine elements and usage/interpretation of FEA results. Create detail part and assembly drawings showing necessary design details of welding instructions, dimensions and tolerances. Ensure BOM accuracy in PLM (Teamcenter) during Engineering releases. Write ECN’s to properly convey the engineering changes resulting from new designs or revisions. Test, troubleshoot and confirm designs meet machine specifications and design requirements. Maintain technical coordination and support with Engineering Supervisors to ensure designs and drawings meet appropriate standards, quality and follow the component and system strategy. Maintain technical coordination and support with Chief Engineers and Engineering Supervisors to ensure on time project completion, product meets specification and is fully tested. Maintain technical coordination to lead Design Engineers to complete tasks that meet appropriate standards and quality. Maintain technical coordination and support with other departments, including, but not limited to, Production, Purchasing, Sales and Customer Service including conducting and documenting cross functional design reviews.   Minimum Required Education:  Bachelors Degree in Mechanical Engineering. Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering is preferred.   Competencies  Application knowledge of mobile equipment, preferably in drilling equipment. Understanding of mechanics of materials and design/application of machine elements. Understanding of machine steel fabrications, manufacturing techniques and processes. Good understanding of common engineering standards for mobile equipment product development. Ability to perform FEA and interpret results (Ansys). CAD package Proficiency (UG/NX and/or MEDUSA preferred. Working within a PDM system (TeamCenter). MS Productivity suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Strong analytical thinking skills. Team work and clear communication skills.   Physical Requirements:    Prolonged periods of time sitting at a desk and working on a computer as well as standing and kneeling in factory.    Must be able to lift 15 pounds at times.    Manual dexterity to visualize, evaluate, install and modify equipment.    Benefits:  Health Insurance- After 30 days you’re eligible for our Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance with Flexible Spending. There’s company paid short term disability insurance and Group Life Insurance. Future Savings - We help you save for retirement in offering a generous 401(k) plan with auto/matching your contribution up to 8%.   Time Off  Rest & Relaxation - We provide up to 2 weeks Paid Time Off your first year of employment along with 11 Company paid holidays. After 1 year of service, you’re awarded 3 Weeks of Vacation. Woohoo! And if you’re feeling under the weather – we have up to 6 sick days a year too.   Career & Other Perks  Career Path - Your success and career at Sandvik is very important to us and we support your professional development by offering online and classroom trainings through our onsite Sandvik Training Academy and offer a College Tuition Reimbursement Program for those wanting to finish a degree or pursue another or other certifications. Promoting the Sandvik Spirit - Community is important to us and we do our best to support and give back to the community and local charities which employees can participate with our Community Service Days Let’s be healthy together - you receive an annual Wellness, Diet and Gym Stipend Fun in the workplace - We have Employee Resource Groups and an Employee Activity Committee that promotes at least one event every quarter. Unlimited Employee Discounts – Part of a global organization there are many employee savings available from purchasing a car, buying a cellphone, or taking the much-needed vacation. These discount programs are from the major automobile manufacturers and famous retail brands, theme parks, etc.   Come Join our Sandvik Family!    How to apply    For immediate consideration, please apply online at      www.sandvik.com   to the Sr Design Engineer Req. ID #R0058147.    Sandvik is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Any applicant who, because of a disability, needs accommodation or assistance in completing an application or at any time during the application process should contact Human Resources at HRsupport.US@sandvik.com. Sandvik also provides reasonable accommodations to employees with disabilities consistent with its obligations under the law.

FEA Engineer: Electrical Test Engineer, High Voltage Battery
column7: What to Expect We are looking to hire entry and early-career Test Engineers for our Hardware Testing team. As an HV battery test engineer, you will work with a passionate and multi-disciplinary group of engineers while learning how to build and use hardware, firmware, and software solutions to validate Tesla vehicle battery products to rigorous internal and automotive-industry standards. This role influences the design of the product through reliability risk identification and testing starting at early concept phases, going through product development and launch, and continuing post launch. A significant amount of the work will be hands-on, in the lab pushing prototypes to their limits and investigating those limitations. We are interested in diverse candidates with relevant experience, but we will prioritize curious and driven engineers with strong problem solving, communication, and collaboration skills. What You’ll Do Execute reliability testing that simulates realistic, accelerated lifetime, and environmental conditions on the battery pack and electrical, mechanical, and thermal sub-systems Design, build, and instrument setups for battery system and component testing, including test fixtures, harnesses, and test PCBAs Develop and maintain automation-focused test software to streamline execution, data collection and analysis Investigate test and field failures to drive product development and test improvement Work with design engineers, reliability scientists, material scientists, quality, and service to identify failure modes and generate design validation and reliability test plans Identify and execute experiments targeting new technologies and critical risks to benefit vehicle products Analyze, document, and present test results to cross-functional teams and leadership Collaborate with test technicians to achieve test objectives What You’ll Bring Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent Experience with analog and digital circuits and familiarity with basic PCB design and circuit simulation Hands-on experience with electrical test equipment (e.g., multimeters, DAQs, oscilloscopes, power supplies, and function generators), instrumentation, and measurement techniques Experience with an object-oriented coding language and scripting (C++, Python, MATLAB, etc.) Ability to read and interpret technical documents such as datasheets, schematics, drawings, and specifications Basic experience with hand tools and power tools An appetite for technical problem solving and hands on work Preferred: Familiarity with high voltage systems and safe working practices Proficiency in Python programming for test automation, data analysis, and equipment control Formal or informal experience with one or more of the following: Automotive components or systems, or vehicles in general Physical testing and analysis of electrical, thermal, or mechanical systems Any form of automation (manufacturing, robotics, testing, personal hobbies, etc.) Interdisciplinary project team (e.g., FSAE or other project) Working understanding and experience of 1 or more: battery systems, digital systems, power electronics, analog and digital circuits, or motor drives Basic understanding or experience with 1 or more: Solid mechanics, fluid dynamics, heat transfer, FEA, 3D CAD software, physics of failure, fatigue analysis Experience creating and executing design validation plans and test methods to validate performance requirements Experience leading, and driving technical projects to completion, especially when multiple teams’ input and buyoff are required Comfort with balancing competing priorities and timelines and aligning those prioritizations with cross-functional team

Job ID: 489840  Exempt  Oldcastle Infrastructure& Trade;, a CRH company, is the leading provider of utility infrastructure solutions for the water, energy, and communications markets throughout North America. We're more than just a manufacturer of precast concrete, polymer concrete, or plastic products. We're a trusted and strategic partner to engineers, contractors, distributors, specifiers, and more. With our network of more than 80 manufacturing facilities and more than 4,000 employees, we're leading the industry with innovation and a safety-first mindset.  Oldcastle Infrastructure - Built For Life from Oldcastle Infrastructure on Vimeo. Position Summary The Engineering Manager shall oversee all Engineering, Drafting and Quality Control operations. The Engineer Manager shall work on various engineering and technical projects, as well as continuous improvements in manufacturing. These projects and duties can vary greatly based on the current needs of the plants. The Engineering Manager must demonstrate the ability to work with specifiers and owners to get our precast products incorporated into project designs. He/she will also need experience in managing Engineers, Drafters and Quality Control personnel. The manager should be able to demonstrate presentation skills to work comfortably in front of a group. There will be occasional overnight travel to other plants, job sites and meeting/seminar locations across the region as needed by current projects being worked on. Essential Duties Manage product design, calculations, drawings, estimating, quotes, production, delivery and installation of precast and pipe products. Assist Plants with Engineering design and production, and improvements to design and production processes. Manage CAD Departments to run effectively. Oversee Drafting Department to improving efficiency and quality of drawings. Develop and provide information on Best Practices in the Engineering and Production Departments (rebar reduction, form improvements, efficiency improvements, mix designs, etc.). Provide technical assistance and perform technical sales presentations in front of a group. Provide engineering and development to new and existing products using design programs such as SAP 2000, RISA 3D, AutoCAD, Excel spreadsheets, Mathcad, etc. Qualifications (Education/Experience) and Required Skills Bachelor of Science in Civil, Mechanical or Structural Engineering. Must possess the ability to read and interpret drawings and be able to perform structural designs for such products as box culverts, bridges and specialty structures. Must be able to use a variety of computer programs, including AutoCAD, FEA, Word, MathCAD, Excel. Must have good organization and communication skills. Must be able to interact with customers, managers, engineers, drafters and other employees to resolve engineering and management related issues. Must be a problem solver and detailed-oriented person. Needs to be a "hands on" personality who can deal with going from an office environment to a plant of field environment. Ability to learn the Oldcastle management structure and MIS system as necessary. Salary Salary ranges between $110,000-$120,000 BOE. What CRH Offers You Highly competitive base pay Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs Group retirement savings program Health and wellness programs A diverse and inclusive culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion About CRH CRH has a long and proud heritage. We are a collection of hundreds of family businesses, regional companies and large enterprises that together form the CRH family. CRH operates in a decentralized, diversified structure that allows you to work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of large international organization. Please complete your online profile and it will be sent to the hiring manager. Our system allows you to view and track your status 24 hours a day. Thank you for your interest! Job Features:Phoenix Fabricators and Erectors, LLC (“Phoenix”), founded in 1986 and headquartered in Avon, Indiana, is one of the nation’s leading construction companies having constructed over 5,000 elevated water storage tanks throughout the United States as well as several foreign countries. By employing our own field crews, we are able to offer a turnkey operation – engineering, fabrication, foundation installation, field erection and painting. We also maintain the industry’s highest-rated safety program to protect our employees and our customers. It is this combination of high-quality construction and safe working environment that has earned us numerous “Tank of the Year” awards from the Steel Tank Institute/Steel Plate Fabricators Association, American Water Works Association, and Tnemec Industrial Coatings.Job Purpose:The Structural Design Engineer is responsible to assist with the design of our core product and provide engineering support to our manufacturing, shipping and logistics, foundation, erection, and coating departments. This requires an individual able to work in the fast-paced, design-build environment of tanks and tank-related structures for the municipal water and industrial markets. After an initial on-site training period, the position may be done remotely, if desired.Description of Essential Duties:· Provide engineering for elevated water towers and above ground tanks. Analyze/design steel plate and reinforced concrete structures. Interpret geotechnical reports to select and design complex foundations.· Apply customer specifications, design standards, and building codes including: AWWA D107 & D100, API, IBC, ASCE, ACI, and AISC.· Direct and oversee detailing work; prepare & seal calculations, drawings, and specifications.· Perform post-design services for troubleshooting and problem resolution.· Provide specialist support and interact closely with other departments: QA/QC, Safety, Construction Operations, Project Management, Procurement.· Work with estimators to prepare bid designs; review vendor submittals.· The above list of duties is not to be construed as an exhaustive list. Other duties logically associated with the position may be assignedSupervisory Responsibilities:· NoneQualification Requirements:(To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. These may be varied based on specific requirements of a location or project)· Bachelor's degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.· Passed Fundamentals of Engineering with the ability to obtain Professional Engineering license within 4-5 years of issuance of EIT.· Structural and mechanical drawing development and review.· High level of proficiency in 2D drafting software, particularly AutoCAD.· Proficient personal computer skills.· Master’s degree in Structural Engineering, preferred.· Professional Engineer license, required. Focus in Structural Engineering, preferred.· Design-Build project experience, preferred.· Working knowledge of codes & standards: AWWA, API, IBC, ASCE, ACI, and AISC, preferred.· Familiarity with Finite Element Analysis (FEA), preferred.· Strong understanding of MATLAB and MathCAD, preferred.Physical Demands:(The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.)Sedentary position requiring extended periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Talking, hearing, and repetitive motions are required. Constantly and repeatedly use keyboard/mouse.Work Environment:(The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.)Clean and climate-controlled office environment.Phoenix Fabricators and Erectors, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. United States of America            State / County 1                       Massachusetts            City 1                       Worcester            Division 1                       Wyman Gordon            Company 1                       Worcester            Function 1                       Engineering            Workplace Type 1                       On-Site            Position type 1                       Full Time           Opportunity ID11049Company Profile 1     With more than 120 operations and approximately 20,000 employees worldwide, Precision Castparts Corp. is the market leader in manufacturing large, complex structural investment castings, airfoil castings, forged components, aerostructures and highly engineered, critical fasteners for aerospace applications. In addition, we are the leading producer of airfoil castings for the industrial gas turbine market. We also manufacture extruded seamless pipe, fittings, and forgings for power generation and oil & gas applications; commercial and military airframe aerostructures; and metal alloys and other materials for the casting and forging industries. With such critical applications, we insist on quality and dependability – not just in the materials and products we make, but in the people we recruit. PCC is relentless in its dedication to being a high-quality, low-cost and on-time producer; delivering the highest value to its customers while continually pursuing strategic, profitable growth. In 2016, Berkshire Hathaway, led by Chairman and CEO Warren E. Buffett, acquired Precision Castparts Corp.Job Description 1     Wyman-Gordon, located in Worcester, MA, provides Isothermal Forgings for military and commercial turbine applications using nickel based and titanium alloys. Full Heat Treating, Machining and Testing on site. This growing, $200 million profit center is part of a highly successful, multi-billion $ diversified manufacturer. Precision Castparts Corporation (PCP). Product Engineer PURPOSE: Position is responsible for providing development and design of forging and manufacturing processes and tooling through forge and heat treat FEA modeling to properly meet customer requirements, then necessary control of estimating, design, processing and tooling to ensure all specs are met in efficient, cost-effective manner. Also provide engineering support to Operations for equipment and facilities. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: Perform design through forge and heat-treat modeling. Lead engineering efforts to obtain, through experimentation and FEA analysis, boundary conditions such that heat treat modeling can be performed. Support and lead cost saving projects/efforts Assist in sales effort. Understanding of forging operations, Unigraphics, and FEA. Maintain quality improvement and industry standards. Quality systems review. Work on six Sigma, FMEA and RC/CA activities EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS: BS Mechanical Engineering required, MS preferred Excellent computer aptitude required with regards to data and statistical analysis, Unigraphics, Finite Element Analysis (FEA), Microsoft Office Knowledge of PCC/Wyman-Gordon operations. 2D Modeling, Deform, CFD Modeling Classical blueprint interpretation / GD&T knowledge. Statistical Analysis. (Six Sigma, Minitab, Quantum SPC). SPECIAL SKILLS AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Strong technical background. Organizational and leadership skills. Strong communication skills. Quality assurance process skills. Can work well with colleagues and customers. ITAR/EAR background US Citizenship or Perm Residency is required due to government military contracts. We are an engineering firm focused on the design of building structures. We seek team-focused, motivated, organized, and results driven persons. We are principally an engineering design firm, working on a mix of new buildings, additions, renovations, and historic structures for both private and public entities. Commensurate with experience, the engineer will be given structural design tasks that will challenge technical skills. The company will provide skills training to match the engineer's knowledge level.The ideal applicant would have experience or some familiarity with reinforced concrete, structural steel, masonry, and wood construction.Responsibilities:- Design and analyze structural systems and components for various construction projects- Perform calculations and use software tools such as Mathcad and FEA to ensure structural integrity- Collaborate with architects, contractors, and other engineers to develop project specifications- Prepare technical drawings and documentation using CAD software, such as Civil 3D and MicroStation- Conduct site visits to assess existing structures and provide recommendations for repairs or modifications- Manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring adherence to timelines and budgets- Stay updated on industry standards and codes related to structural engineering- Provide guidance and mentorship to junior engineersRequirements:- College level degree in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, or Architectural Engineering. ASSISTANT DESIGN ENGINEER       Apply      ASSISTANT DESIGN ENGINEER Agency: DEPT OF ENVIRONMENT PROTECTION        Posted on: 08/21/2023       Job type: Full-time Location QUEENSTitle Classification: Exam may be required DepartmentTUNNEL STRUCTURAL DESIGN      Salary range: $62,370.00 – $93,587.00      Job DescriptionThe NYC Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) enriches the environment and protects public health for all New Yorkers by providing 1.1 billion gallons of high-quality drinking water, managing wastewater and storm water, and reducing air, noise, and hazardous materials pollution. DEP is the largest combined municipal water and wastewater utility in the country, with nearly 6,000 employees. DEP's water supply system is comprised of 19 reservoirs and 3 controlled lakes throughout the system’s 2,000 square mile watershed that extends 125 miles north and west of the City.  The Bureau of Engineering Design & Construction (BEDC) currently has a portfolio of capital projects valued at $23.8B, and another $10.5B projected over the next 10-year commitment plan. The projects BEDC implements allows DEP as a whole to continue to operate and maintain an exemplary water supply system.  Our In-House Design (IHD) directorate provides design and engineering services to meet operations’ needs in a manner consistent with BEDC’s core values of safety, schedule, quality, and customer service. IHD supports projects from the business case through preliminary design, design, procurement, construction, and finally with the turnover to operations. IHD’s Design Services division includes Architectural, Site Civil, Structural, Process Mechanical/HVAC, Water Tunnel Mechanical Systems, and Electrical discipline sections. Each design section prepares design and construction documents including engineering plans and specifications for the construction of water supply, sewer, and wastewater treatment infrastructure. IHD projects are typically of the highest priority for the Agency. IHD’s Engineering Services includes the Quality Assurance, Laboratory Services, Specifications/Standard Operating Procedures, Sustainability, and BIM/CADD sections. The Engineering Services division focuses on project’s sustainability, resiliency, laboratory material testing, quality reviews and inspections, standardization of documents, project delivery standards and uses current BIM/CADD technology to streamline engineering design processes.  BEDC seeks to hire three Assistant Civil Engineers for IHD’s Structural Section, located at our headquarters in Queens, NY. Under supervision of the Lead Design Engineer, the selected candidates will assist in the implementation of capital projects through the design phase by preparing engineering documents for water tunnels, wastewater treatment systems, and other large, complex facilities which are of the highest priority for the agency. Specific work areas in which the selected engineers will be engaged include, but are not limited to, preparing of plans, specifications and related calculations; conducting field visits; design services during construction (DSDC) including reviewing shop drawings, material approvals and requests for information; preparing change orders; conducting research; preparing proposals and reports; witness shop testing and commissioning of structural systems; development of project schedules; communicating and coordinating with other engineers and stakeholders; and documenting issues/resolutions in issues logs. The selected candidates may also review and/or oversee staff review of designs prepared by outsourced engineering firms for the same types of facilities. This position will also require traveling to job sites to perform site investigations and attend site meetings during design and construction phases of projects, as needed. Minimum Qualifications      1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college in civil engineering and one year of full-time satisfactory experience in civil engineering work; or  2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and a Master's degree from an accredited college in civil engineering. Preferred Skills      1. One (1) year of full-time, satisfactory experience in civil engineering work with emphasis on structural work. 2. A degree in structural engineering degree from an accredited college. Master’s degree in structural engineering preferred. 3. Knowledge of structural engineering and the design of reinforced concrete and steel structures. 4. Proficient use of AutoCAD and Revit. 5. Experience designing using Finite Element Analysis (FEA) programs such as, but not limited to, STAAD Pro (Bentley), RAM Elements (Bentley), or SAFE (CSI). 6. Experience in the planning, layout and details of contract drawings specifications shop drawing review and field inspections and investigations. 7. Experience in shaft and tunnel structural design and/or building /facility design. 8. Experience in the application of code requirements and preparation of technical reports and submitting formal design calculations. 9. Strong verbal and written communication skills. 10. Experience in use of Microsoft Office Applications such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. 11. Preference will be given to candidates who have passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam. 12. This position may require operation of a motor vehicle to perform site visits, equipment testing, inspections, and to attend meetings with project stakeholders. Provides direction and assistance to the engineering team in order to meet assigned objectives. Interactions will include engineering sub-system teams, drafting and global engineering sites. Manage long term planning to meet the project milestone fulfillments. Review and approve designs and 2-D drawings developed by designers. Post-Doctoral position: “ In-silico Clinical Trial - Evaluation of endoscopy devices in a Virtual Esophagus cohort” Long Island University hosts a leading Dassault Systèmes Center of Excellence in Life Sciences. Through our collaboration with Dassault Systèmes and Baylor College of Medicine, we are spearheading the digital transformation of life science, education and clinical practice by leveraging advanced computational methods, AI and in-silico modeling. We are looking for a qualified post-doctoral fellow with expertise in applied computational sciences, such as Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Applied Physics, Applied Mathematics, or Medical Physics. This position is within a multi-disciplinary research team at Long Island University, collaborating with the Baylor College of Medicine. Your main responsibility will be to reconstruct a virtual cohort of patients' esophagus based on specific patient data. Specifically, you will be tasked with building multi-layered esophagus computational models and conducting simulations using ABAQUS. The aim of these models and simulations is to quantify and predict tissue damage, which will contribute to obtaining regulatory approval for novel endoscopy diagnostic medical devices. By leveraging computational tools, your work will help in understanding and evaluating the potential effects of these medical devices on the esophagus. This research is vital for ensuring the safety and efficacy of these devices before they can be introduced into clinical practice. In summary, as a post-doctoral fellow in this role, you will be responsible for creating and analyzing multi-layered esophagus computational models. These models will be utilized to simulate tissue damage and support the regulatory approval process for innovative endoscopy diagnostic medical devices. Key Responsibilities o Conceive, develop, and implement human esophagus virtual twins from patient specific data. o Generate FEA data from the virtual cohort of human esophagus. o Quantify GI device induced damaged to soft biological tissue (esophagus lumen). o Work closely with a cross disciplinary team of engineers and leverage cross-domain expertise to contribute to a rigorous scientific evidence package strategically aligned with regulatory submission. o Lead drafting of scientific publications and patents. o May supervise students, and more junior colleagues. Job Qualifications o Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Applied Physics, Applied Mathematics, Medical Physics or similar. o Strong technical expertise in CAD and Simulation (ABAQUS, CATIA, SOLIDWORKS, COMSOL, ANSYS or equivalent) o Proven track records (publication in top-tier journals, awards, patents, white papers) o Proficiency with one or more programming language such as Python, Matlab or C++. o Ability to present analytical results on behalf of the project team to senior leadership. o Ability to influence or persuade others to accept new ideas, approaches or concepts and on the direction of projects and manage stakeholders through project execution. Advisors Engineering Lead: Dr. Nicolas Gallo, Assistant Professor, Digital Engineering, LIU Clinical Lead: Dr. Sharmila Anandasabapthy, Professor, Gastroenterology, BCM Primary Location Long Island University, Brooklyn Campus, Brooklyn, NY More on LIU’s Center of Excellence with Dassault Systemes  Long Island University (LIU) has formed a research and innovation partnership with Dassault Systèmes in life sciences. The collaboration focuses on impactful research in pharmaceutical sciences, precision medicine, and healthcare in the digital age. The research involves the development of "Virtual Twins," digital models of human anatomy, to advance precision medicine. LIU has also opened in 2020 a state-of-the-art simulation and high-performance computing laboratory equipped with Dassault Systèmes' 3D, augmented reality, and virtual reality software. This facility supports experiential research, education, and training in various fields, including AI, robotics, cybersecurity, and drug discovery. LIU is committed to extending equal opportunity in employment to all qualified candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of our academic community. LIU encourages applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender and/or gender identity or expression, marital or parental status, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship status, veteran or military status, age, disability or any other basis protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. Hiring is contingent on eligibility to work in the United States.

column7: Wiss, Janney, Elstner Associates, Inc. (WJE) is seeking an exceptional entry-level Mechanical Engineering Associate to join our Heavy Movable Structures team in Doylestown, Pennsylvania. WJE is a global firm of engineers, architects, and materials scientists committed to helping solve, repair, and avoid problems in the built world since 1956. In 2019, Stafford Bandlow Engineering (SBE) officially joined WJE, bringing more than 150 years of combined experience consulting on all aspects of heavy movable structures. At WJE, we spend almost as much time in the field, up close and personal with our projects, as we do in the office. As a Mechanical Engineering Associate, you will apply theoretical knowledge to practical applications primarily related to the machinery for heavy movable structures, including movable bridges, locks and dams, ferry terminals, and cranes. As a Mechanical Engineering Associate, you will not only have the opportunity to learn from and grow alongside industry experts, but you will also be an integral part of building WJE's emerging Heavy Movable Structures practice. Responsibilities:Assume responsibility for key aspects of projects and complete assignments under the guidance of licensed professionalsPerform on-site investigations, condition assessments, and construction observations, which may include surveying, documenting distress, field testing, collecting data and samples, and preparing site visit reportsPrepare instrumentation and conduct field testing using various gauges and sensorsAnalyze field data and perform research to facilitate problem-solving and repair designPerform calculations for counterweight balancing and analysis of new and existing machinery partsAssist with drafting and preparation of client deliverables, including construction documents, specifications, and written reportsQualifications:Bachelor's degree or better in mechanical engineering, engineering sciences, or a related field, from an accredited programOne to two years of internships and other related work experienceStrong technical, written, and verbal communication skillsPractical software knowledge of MathCAD, AutoCAD, FEA, and the full Microsoft Office SuiteSolid foundation in mechanics, dynamics, kinematics, and machine designEnthusiasm and curiosity for solving problems and understanding how things workAbility to work in the field, both locally and outside the local area, including CanadaValid driver's license and authorized passport without travel restrictionsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This position requires visual acuity and listening ability. Individuals must have the dexterity to be able to operate office and field equipment such as computer, printer, fax, copier, telephone, voice mail system, and other office and field equipment. Requirements may also include:Ability to attend meetings at the various office, field, and construction sitesAbility to perform inspections of buildings and other structures, both visually and with instrumentsAbility to lift and carry materials and equipment up to 50 lbs.Ability to perform work in the temperature extremes presented by work in the outdoorsAbility to read construction drawings, diagrams, printed materials, and computer screensAbility to record data clearly and write passages for reports, letters, etc.Ability to travelAbility to safely work at heightsAbility to safely work in confined spaces, including permit-required confined spacesAbility to safely use and/or operate ladders, scaffolds, lifts, and other access equipmentAbility to understand and appreciate safety training specific to numerous workplace and construction hazardsAbility to safely work in a variety of occupationally hazardous locationsMedically fit to utilize respiratory protection devices and other forms of Personal Protective EquipmentAbility to drive and safely operate a motor vehicleAnnual starting base salary (gross): $63,300 - $96,900. Actual salaries will vary and will be based on several factors including consideration for a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, and proficiency for the role. Base salary is one component of our total compensation package for employees. WJE offers an industry-leading total rewards package that enables our employees to grow and thrive with comprehensive health and financial benefits including robust and affordable health plans, generous 401(k) matching and bonus programs, time off to care for yourself and others, and investments in employees’ professional development, to name a few. More information on WJE’s total rewards package can be found here. WJE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We invite all qualified applicants to apply including individuals with disabilities, minorities, women, and protected veterans (VEVRAA federal contractor). WJE will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of Fair Chance Ordinances. FEA Engineer: Electrical Test Engineer, High Voltage Battery
column7: What to Expect We are looking to hire entry and early-career Test Engineers for our Hardware Testing team. As an HV battery test engineer, you will work with a passionate and multi-disciplinary group of engineers while learning how to build and use hardware, firmware, and software solutions to validate Tesla vehicle battery products to rigorous internal and automotive-industry standards. This role influences the design of the product through reliability risk identification and testing starting at early concept phases, going through product development and launch, and continuing post launch. A significant amount of the work will be hands-on, in the lab pushing prototypes to their limits and investigating those limitations. We are interested in diverse candidates with relevant experience, but we will prioritize curious and driven engineers with strong problem solving, communication, and collaboration skills. What You’ll Do Execute reliability testing that simulates realistic, accelerated lifetime, and environmental conditions on the battery pack and electrical, mechanical, and thermal sub-systems Design, build, and instrument setups for battery system and component testing, including test fixtures, harnesses, and test PCBAs Develop and maintain automation-focused test software to streamline execution, data collection and analysis Investigate test and field failures to drive product development and test improvement Work with design engineers, reliability scientists, material scientists, quality, and service to identify failure modes and generate design validation and reliability test plans Identify and execute experiments targeting new technologies and critical risks to benefit vehicle products Analyze, document, and present test results to cross-functional teams and leadership Collaborate with test technicians to achieve test objectives What You’ll Bring Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent Experience with analog and digital circuits and familiarity with basic PCB design and circuit simulation Hands-on experience with electrical test equipment (e.g., multimeters, DAQs, oscilloscopes, power supplies, and function generators), instrumentation, and measurement techniques Experience with an object-oriented coding language and scripting (C++, Python, MATLAB, etc.) Ability to read and interpret technical documents such as datasheets, schematics, drawings, and specifications Basic experience with hand tools and power tools An appetite for technical problem solving and hands on work Preferred: Familiarity with high voltage systems and safe working practices Proficiency in Python programming for test automation, data analysis, and equipment control Formal or informal experience with one or more of the following: Automotive components or systems, or vehicles in general Physical testing and analysis of electrical, thermal, or mechanical systems Any form of automation (manufacturing, robotics, testing, personal hobbies, etc.) Interdisciplinary project team (e.g., FSAE or other project) Working understanding and experience of 1 or more: battery systems, digital systems, power electronics, analog and digital circuits, or motor drives Basic understanding or experience with 1 or more: Solid mechanics, fluid dynamics, heat transfer, FEA, 3D CAD software, physics of failure, fatigue analysis Experience creating and executing design validation plans and test methods to validate performance requirements Experience leading, and driving technical projects to completion, especially when multiple teams’ input and buyoff are required Comfort with balancing competing priorities and timelines and aligning those prioritizations with cross-functional team

We open up your world with every drive Would you like to work on the development of roof systems for future car models together with some of the market leaders in the automotive industry? Inalfa Roof Systems is a world leading supplier for OEM automotive roof systems and still growing strong. Are you ready to grow with us? SUMMARY  Are you ready to shift into the next gear of your career? As Warranty Engineer within Inalfa you are in the driver’s seat for reviewing and conducting root cause analysis of OEM warranty returned parts and analyze data to identify trends. This position also identifies corrective actions and works with various internal departments to document and track progress for issue solution.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Analyze all OEM warranty returned parts using problem solving methodologies Provide quality / reliability analysis input and direction to product design and development process APQP to assure reliability of new product launches and prioritize design improvements under compressed schedules Use statistical approach (DfX, DFSS) to assess current product reliability, structure gap analysis, support technological risk assessments, and develop risk mitigation / integration plans Support maintenance of appropriate project & Milestone documentation such as test plans, test status reports, FRACAS and drives FMEA’s early in the design phase to optimize design & mitigate risk during the development process. Support Design Reviews to help the organization identify, remove, and avoid reliability issues. Utilize Reliability models and predictions (MTTF, MTBF). Analyze system reliability through Reliability Block Diagramming (RBD). Support the development of sub-systems and component’s reliability. Support application of Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and Design for Six Sigma (DFSS) techniques. Support design engineers in Tolerance or Worst-Case Analysis for mechanical components and sub-systems testing. Support failure analysis of any development test failure so that early detection of flaws, careful analysis of expected failure mechanisms, and thorough root cause analysis is available to make final design decisions before product launch. Provide Warranty Prediction based on Design Validation (DV) and Production Validation (PV) results. Monitor expected product failure rate over time to feed into field support considerations and recommend design improvements. Apply warranty / field performance data analysis to verify test results and monitor reliability growth. Apply Fault Tree Analysis (FTA) and Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) to help establish realistic sub-system goals and identify high risk areas, their impact, and potential mitigation Processes disposition of returns in customer systems Conducts and monitors testing of defective parts Analyzes data to identify trends Documents emerging issues and proposes corrective and preventative actions Monitors progress of all open warranty corrective actions Creates tracking and trending metrics for warranty returns Maintains process flow and other documentation as required by customer and internal standards Provides support in development of customer service bulletins May include dealership or customer plant visits and dealership call log maintenance May travel 5-10% to customer sites for parts evaluation SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES None. TS 16949 and ISO 14001 RESPONSIBILITIES The responsibilities listed in the Inalfa Roof System TS16949 Quality Manual and ISO 14001 Environmental Manual pertaining to this position are mandatory. Other responsibilities may be added, with or without notice in writing, at any time and it is the responsibility of this position to review such changes on a period basis. QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE 4-year Bachelor’s degree with a major in engineering preferred. LANGUAGE SKILLS Have the ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Have the ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Have the ability to present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public effectively. MATHEMATICAL SKILLS Have the ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference. Have the ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios and proportions to practical situations. REASONING ABILITY Have the ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Have the ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. COMPUTER SKILLSExcellent data analysis and computer skills; must be proficient in MS Office Suite particularly Word, Excel and PowerPoint and reliability software. Experience using WinSmith and/or Minitab preferred. Preferred knowledge of Ubiquiti, Covisint, and specific customer systems: BMW: b2b Stellantis: PRAS +, WIS/EWT, GIM Ford: WPRC, BASQ, GSAR, GWC GM: GART, Part Link Daimler: SRS, QEC-Tool Honda: Honda Web, QCP What can you expect from us? Paid vacation. Paid sick time. Healthcare, dental, prescription drug insurance plans. Company paid and voluntary life insurance plans. Disability benefits. Our Core Values are One Inalfa, Ownership, Ambition and Progress. WE ARE IN IT TO WIN IT! Does this sound interesting to you? Don't hesitate and submit your application today. Location Cherokee Assembly  Time Type Full time  Contact Person Keri Martin

Overview:   Who We Are:   Lippert is a leading, global manufacturer and supplier of highly engineered products and customized solutions, dedicated to shaping, growing and bettering the RV, marine, automotive, commercial vehicle and building products industries. We combine our strategic manufacturing capabilities with the power of our winning team culture to deliver unrivaled customer service, award-winning innovation, and premium products to all of our customers.  Why We are Different: At Lippert, Everyone Matters. This is not just a tagline or empty promise; it is who we are. We have intentionally created a culture that values and celebrates our team members’ unique and varied backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We strive to give our team members a deeper sense of purpose at work, and we continue to build a better work environment by aligning our cultural and business strategies with the needs of our team members. What You will Get: A unique, inclusive and supportive company culture. Comprehensive benefit offerings including medical, dental, vision, 401k with employer match, vacation, and more! Fair and competitive compensation. Career development and mentoring and opportunities to grow. Holiday, personal and vacation days. Summary/Objective:   The Product Engineer will focus on new product development and aide in maintaining existing products. Primary responsibilities would include developing products from concept stage to production-ready, supporting existing manufactured products through VAVE and Continuous Improvement efforts, and working closely with an internal cross-functional team and external customers. Research and analyze data such as customer design proposals, specifications, competitor products, warranty data, etc to determine feasibility of product design or application Write design validation plans and testing procedures Lead teams on FMEA processes Help create project schedule and drive timelines Create conceptual and prototype designs, images, and prototypes Design electromechanical/mechanical products or systems such as rack and pinion drive systems, linear motion control, water management systems, load distribution, etc to fit application requirements Detail component and assembly designs/models and create engineering prints with use of GD&T Works with Manufacturing Engineering and Suppliers to assure most efficient methods of manufacture (DFM) and assembly (DFA) are developed to meet appropriate specifications. ASSISTANT DESIGN ENGINEER       Apply      ASSISTANT DESIGN ENGINEER Agency: DEPT OF ENVIRONMENT PROTECTION        Posted on: 08/21/2023       Job type: Full-time Location QUEENSTitle Classification: Exam may be required DepartmentTUNNEL STRUCTURAL DESIGN      Salary range: $62,370.00 – $93,587.00      Job DescriptionThe NYC Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) enriches the environment and protects public health for all New Yorkers by providing 1.1 billion gallons of high-quality drinking water, managing wastewater and storm water, and reducing air, noise, and hazardous materials pollution. DEP is the largest combined municipal water and wastewater utility in the country, with nearly 6,000 employees. DEP's water supply system is comprised of 19 reservoirs and 3 controlled lakes throughout the system’s 2,000 square mile watershed that extends 125 miles north and west of the City.  The Bureau of Engineering Design & Construction (BEDC) currently has a portfolio of capital projects valued at $23.8B, and another $10.5B projected over the next 10-year commitment plan. The projects BEDC implements allows DEP as a whole to continue to operate and maintain an exemplary water supply system.  Our In-House Design (IHD) directorate provides design and engineering services to meet operations’ needs in a manner consistent with BEDC’s core values of safety, schedule, quality, and customer service. IHD supports projects from the business case through preliminary design, design, procurement, construction, and finally with the turnover to operations. IHD’s Design Services division includes Architectural, Site Civil, Structural, Process Mechanical/HVAC, Water Tunnel Mechanical Systems, and Electrical discipline sections. Each design section prepares design and construction documents including engineering plans and specifications for the construction of water supply, sewer, and wastewater treatment infrastructure. IHD projects are typically of the highest priority for the Agency. IHD’s Engineering Services includes the Quality Assurance, Laboratory Services, Specifications/Standard Operating Procedures, Sustainability, and BIM/CADD sections. The Engineering Services division focuses on project’s sustainability, resiliency, laboratory material testing, quality reviews and inspections, standardization of documents, project delivery standards and uses current BIM/CADD technology to streamline engineering design processes.  BEDC seeks to hire three Assistant Civil Engineers for IHD’s Structural Section, located at our headquarters in Queens, NY. Under supervision of the Lead Design Engineer, the selected candidates will assist in the implementation of capital projects through the design phase by preparing engineering documents for water tunnels, wastewater treatment systems, and other large, complex facilities which are of the highest priority for the agency. Specific work areas in which the selected engineers will be engaged include, but are not limited to, preparing of plans, specifications and related calculations; conducting field visits; design services during construction (DSDC) including reviewing shop drawings, material approvals and requests for information; preparing change orders; conducting research; preparing proposals and reports; witness shop testing and commissioning of structural systems; development of project schedules; communicating and coordinating with other engineers and stakeholders; and documenting issues/resolutions in issues logs. The selected candidates may also review and/or oversee staff review of designs prepared by outsourced engineering firms for the same types of facilities. This position will also require traveling to job sites to perform site investigations and attend site meetings during design and construction phases of projects, as needed. Minimum Qualifications      1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college in civil engineering and one year of full-time satisfactory experience in civil engineering work; or  2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and a Master's degree from an accredited college in civil engineering. Preferred Skills      1. One (1) year of full-time, satisfactory experience in civil engineering work with emphasis on structural work. 2. A degree in structural engineering degree from an accredited college. Master’s degree in structural engineering preferred. 3. Knowledge of structural engineering and the design of reinforced concrete and steel structures. 4. Proficient use of AutoCAD and Revit. 5. Experience designing using Finite Element Analysis (FEA) programs such as, but not limited to, STAAD Pro (Bentley), RAM Elements (Bentley), or SAFE (CSI). 6. Experience in the planning, layout and details of contract drawings specifications shop drawing review and field inspections and investigations. 7. Experience in shaft and tunnel structural design and/or building /facility design. 8. Experience in the application of code requirements and preparation of technical reports and submitting formal design calculations. 9. Strong verbal and written communication skills. 10. Experience in use of Microsoft Office Applications such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. 11. Preference will be given to candidates who have passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam. 12. This position may require operation of a motor vehicle to perform site visits, equipment testing, inspections, and to attend meetings with project stakeholders. Possession of a valid NYS Driver’s License may be required for this job assignment.            55a Program      This position is also open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a Program. Post-Doctoral position: “ In-silico Clinical Trial - Evaluation of endoscopy devices in a Virtual Esophagus cohort” Long Island University hosts a leading Dassault Systèmes Center of Excellence in Life Sciences. Through our collaboration with Dassault Systèmes and Baylor College of Medicine, we are spearheading the digital transformation of life science, education and clinical practice by leveraging advanced computational methods, AI and in-silico modeling. We are looking for a qualified post-doctoral fellow with expertise in applied computational sciences, such as Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Applied Physics, Applied Mathematics, or Medical Physics. This position is within a multi-disciplinary research team at Long Island University, collaborating with the Baylor College of Medicine. Your main responsibility will be to reconstruct a virtual cohort of patients' esophagus based on specific patient data. Specifically, you will be tasked with building multi-layered esophagus computational models and conducting simulations using ABAQUS. The aim of these models and simulations is to quantify and predict tissue damage, which will contribute to obtaining regulatory approval for novel endoscopy diagnostic medical devices. By leveraging computational tools, your work will help in understanding and evaluating the potential effects of these medical devices on the esophagus. This research is vital for ensuring the safety and efficacy of these devices before they can be introduced into clinical practice. In summary, as a post-doctoral fellow in this role, you will be responsible for creating and analyzing multi-layered esophagus computational models. These models will be utilized to simulate tissue damage and support the regulatory approval process for innovative endoscopy diagnostic medical devices. Key Responsibilities o Conceive, develop, and implement human esophagus virtual twins from patient specific data. o Generate FEA data from the virtual cohort of human esophagus. o Quantify GI device induced damaged to soft biological tissue (esophagus lumen). o Work closely with a cross disciplinary team of engineers and leverage cross-domain expertise to contribute to a rigorous scientific evidence package strategically aligned with regulatory submission. o Lead drafting of scientific publications and patents. o May supervise students, and more junior colleagues. Job Qualifications o Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Applied Physics, Applied Mathematics, Medical Physics or similar. o Strong technical expertise in CAD and Simulation (ABAQUS, CATIA, SOLIDWORKS, COMSOL, ANSYS or equivalent) o Proven track records (publication in top-tier journals, awards, patents, white papers) o Proficiency with one or more programming language such as Python, Matlab or C++. o Ability to present analytical results on behalf of the project team to senior leadership. o Ability to influence or persuade others to accept new ideas, approaches or concepts and on the direction of projects and manage stakeholders through project execution. Advisors Engineering Lead: Dr. Nicolas Gallo, Assistant Professor, Digital Engineering, LIU Clinical Lead: Dr. Sharmila Anandasabapthy, Professor, Gastroenterology, BCM Primary Location Long Island University, Brooklyn Campus, Brooklyn, NY More on LIU’s Center of Excellence with Dassault Systemes  Long Island University (LIU) has formed a research and innovation partnership with Dassault Systèmes in life sciences. The collaboration focuses on impactful research in pharmaceutical sciences, precision medicine, and healthcare in the digital age. The research involves the development of "Virtual Twins," digital models of human anatomy, to advance precision medicine. LIU has also opened in 2020 a state-of-the-art simulation and high-performance computing laboratory equipped with Dassault Systèmes' 3D, augmented reality, and virtual reality software. This facility supports experiential research, education, and training in various fields, including AI, robotics, cybersecurity, and drug discovery. LIU is committed to extending equal opportunity in employment to all qualified candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of our academic community. LIU encourages applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender and/or gender identity or expression, marital or parental status, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship status, veteran or military status, age, disability or any other basis protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. Hiring is contingent on eligibility to work in the United States.

JOB DESCRIPTION: We are looking for a creative Mechanical Engineer to work on all product stages from research and development to design and manufacture, through to installation and final commissioning.
